p: Infections with the organism lead to Q fever, which is characterized by relapsing fevers, pneumonitis, endocarditis, and hepatitis. Characteristically, the serum alkaline phosphatase is elevated disproportionately to the mild rise in serum bilirubin and transaminases. Fibrin ring granulomas are seen on liver biopsy and treatment is with doxycycline [ 19, 20].
